column4: USB drive removal process: "eject", "unmount", or "safely remove"? what's the difference?

unmount is to .. well.. unmount the file system on the usb stick.. it will flush out anything in the buffer and so on.. eject might be for cd's and such that physically has to be ejected.. safely remove I'm guessing is the same as unmount
so it is a bug then? there should not be duplicate functions. it is confusing.
hmm.. indeed.. I get both unmount and "safely remove" as well.. perhaps there is some small difference
I'm guessing any will work.. if anything I think "safely remove" might be a little more safe in some hidden, secret way =)
then I would go with unmount .. that should only affect the file system.. not the usb device itself
have you used PlayOnLinux? I ran sims 3 flawlessly, it is awesome

for playing games there just isn't a good alternative.. wine is a very nice effort and major kudos to them for all the work they've done.. but they still have a lot of ground to cover before you can even say that 50% of all the windows apps works the same way in wine as in windows
I've used wine, which playonlinux is based on.. unless they've done some serious rewriting they won't be that much different
yes, they have done a heck of a lot of work, you should give it a serious try before you bash it. they have a database of games and very specific wine config options per-game. it is very spiffy
it's still wine.. no matter how much makeup you put on it

indus: both of you are talking without experience of the product i am referencing. it does use wine, but i am here to tell you my 3d game for windows ran flawlessly with full 3d and surround sound on ubuntu jaunty
look.. this discussion isn't really going anywhere.. perhaps #winehq or #ubuntu-offtopic might be a better place
but...but he said..he wants to use windows.. :(
this isn't a linux advocacy channel.. it's ubuntu support..
you can try to convert him in the offtopic channel
